text: well certainly Ash Wednesday brings back
horrific memories for Australians
fortunately in this case there's been no
loss of life and we're grateful for that
and the injuries have been mainly smoke
inhalation and the like so in reality
we're fortunate that there's been not
the loss of life associated with ash
wednesday but nonetheless in the
adelaide area alone at least 26 houses
have been lost another 40 or more
outbuildings and for the families that
have lost everything clearly they now
have a rebuilding task ahead of them and
as the temperatures are due to pick up
and the wind speeds due to pick up what
is your concern well certainly there's
been a little respite over the last
couple of days as temperatures have
dropped even a few showers in a few
places that's enabled firefighters to
get on top of things in Victoria the
concentration therefore has been around
adelaide and and the weather temperature
forecasts for 238 degree days coming up
with wind issues as well and so there's
potentially new danger coming up over
the next couple of days we hope that the
the rest bite has given firefighters an
opportunity to to try and trim some of
the edges of the fire it is over 200
kilometres front to the fires around
adelaide and so it's a massive part to
try and contain it so that it can be
managed when the weather is likely to be
worse over the next couple of days and
what is your advice to people who are
still on the grounds well people are
taking local advice from their local
fire controllers many people have left
their homes and moved to safer places
most have come back now because of these
two better days but another decision
will probably have to be made to most
people in the next day or so as to
whether they again move away to protect
themselves and their families or whether
they want to stay back stay at home and
try and fight the blaze and particular
property that's a decision that each
household has to make it's always a
trying one and clearly the community
gets behind one another supports
sold the firefighters have been very
active firefighters are coming in from
other states to help the equipment
that's assembled and maintained
throughout the year is being located and
has been located to the major fire areas
so we're doing everything we possibly
can but nature is powerful fires are
powerful and everyone must respond that
to that threat
